body:
Oh.. OK. Awesome.
So is Create.Values being deprecated ? And this is a "transition" solution ?

Create.Values is being removed from the list of model-primitive transforms, and replaced with an implementation based on Read.Bounded

This is a transition solution that allows the implementation of Create.Values to remain a Primitive that the SparkPipelineRunner supports and allowing the default implementation of Create to move to a composite built on top of Read.Bounded (in #183).

When the SparkPipelineRunner supports the Read primitive, this should be removed, and we can get rid of create in the Spark TransformTranslator.

Yea, the primitive transforms are moving to the [list here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bao-5B6uBuf-kwH1meenAuXXS0c9cBQ1B2J59I3FiyI/edit#heading=h.tt55lhd3k6by). We've been altering the SDK to match, while adding overrides to the runners so there is no behavioral change.

Yep, I remember now :)
so +1 from me.
BTW @tgroh the behaviour you described in `super.apply(Override, PInput)` will only work for `PTransform<PInput, PCollection<T>>` or also for transformations like `GroupByKey` ?
LGTM
It works for arbitrary PTransforms

LGTM

is and get are the same for boolean properties as per javabeans

LGTM, modulo pending comments.
Looks pretty good. Left a few (very) minor comments. Also, @dhalperi should take a peek too.
@tgroh looks like you have LGTMs from everyone? I am happy to play the role of mergebot if you need a committer in order to unblock you on #183

R: @kennknowles 
PTAL

Sorry Ken, forgot to reply: Yes, I took account of all state and not just timers. I strengthened the unit test accordingly. Still a little uneasy about eliding end-of-window (== end-of-time) holds in the GlobalWindow.
Since I was fiddling with end-of-time values, I also took the opportunity to fix BEAM-122 while in there.

Tests are passing with #214 in the history.

PTAL.
Drive-by LGTM

R: @kennknowles @peihe

R: @lukecwik
+1 Good to merge.

> @mxm touches the Flink slightly, though I didn't go all the way yet. Do you agree that if I do the same thing to the Flink runner that I did to the Spark runner it will mirror the intent?

Adjusting in the same way you started with the Spark runner should work. I think we have two cases for composite transforms:
- direct translation of composite transforms 
- conditional composite transform translation depending on the number of inputs

Otherwise, we just visit the primitive transforms that the composite transform is composed of.
LGTM
LGTM
PTAL.

R: @davorbonaci

Have you thought of using @AutoService to generate the service loader files during build time?

You just add the annotation @AutoService and depend on:
<dependencies>
  <dependency>
    <groupId>com.google.auto.service</groupId>
    <artifactId>auto-service</artifactId>
    <version>${version}</version>
    <optional>true</optional>
  </dependency>
</dependencies>

More info here: https://github.com/google/auto/tree/master/service
LGTM

Ok, I've split this off to be just primitive IO transforms; composites will be handled in branch [displaydata-io-composites](https://github.com/swegner/incubator-beam/pull/14).

@kennknowles for committer

> I think you missed CountingSource?

`CountingSource` is deprecated in favor of `CountingInput`. I've added added display data for it in the next PR for composites.

Using AutoService is more "Beamish" and got rid of a bunch of classes, so it looks good - Thanks @lukecwik and @dhalperi 
Since this PR is completely different (except for the README part), please review, Thanks!
Done.
Minor fix ups and then LGTM

R: @lukecwik 

(Nothing to add here.)
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @lukecwik

@davorbonaci Should AutoValue get backported to Dataflow SDK?

**Reasons NOT TO backport**: It's not new functionality.
**Reasons TO backport**: Other functionality we backport may depend on it. This is already the case with DisplayData.

I'm leaning towards not backporting. It should be easy to re-implement the parts of DisplayData which depend on it. /cc @bjchambers
I think the best choice is to back-port on a need basis, i.e., if and when another PR needs it.

any lgtm will do. Since this is not removing the Deprecated API itself, can not cause any breakages a'la [BEAM-168](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-168)

Hi, Can you please close this PR and open the original submission?

Doing so will allow us to track your changes over time, to maintain review history and reviewers.

Please read the [Beam Contributors Guide](http://beam.incubator.apache.org/contribution-guide/#code-review-and-revision)

@dhalperi I think we're good-to-go. There's a single travis failure, but it looks like a flake.

R: @dhalperi
I'm going to follow your advice in the issue and nuke this entirely. Stand by.

It's Friday, I'm already 3 steps removed from the problem I set out to solve.
Adding a test and leaving this in place.
+1 from me

Upon additional work for partial bundle completion, this isn't a prerequisite - the uncompleted elements can be placed back in the queue of pending work as part of the output bundles.

Closing the CR, but keeping the branch alive in case we decide to merge bundles.
PTAL
